entry.title: Personal Finance Budgeting in Home Lab

link.title: Personal Finance Budgeting in Home Lab

entry.summary: Intro Personal finance is more than just a practice - it’s a skill. But at the same time, finding a good, privacy-focused application to help manage personal finances is very hard. Many applications are either paywalled for tiers of features, or hold your data hostage to make migration harder. Of course, there are good paid services as well, but an open-source application that can be deployed ...

entry.title: Dragon Ball Z - Cell Saga Timeline 101

link.title: Dragon Ball Z - Cell Saga Timeline 101

entry.summary: Whats and Whys Time travel has always been a fascination of the entertainment industry and Anime is no exception. Complicated timelines and going back in time to change history are very common concepts. But portraying them properly is hard and often gets very convoluted in the finished product. Also, because information about the storyline is mixed in with the time travel concepts, many a time...

entry.title: Excalidraw in Home Lab
entry.summary: Excalidraw Excalidraw is an open source infinite-canvas whiteboard software. It is primary local-first and the public hosted version is end to end encrypted, with support for live collaboration as well. The online version of the software has some additional features as well, such as generative AI features, a laser pointer for presentations, and mermaid diagram to excalidraw functionality. For...

entry.title: Expense Tracking in Home Lab
entry.summary: Whats and Whys I wrote a tool called Budgeter for one straightforward reason - to track expenses. There are so so so so many tools out there that do the same. And they do it so well, with so many features. What I wrote is too simple, so why not just use one of the existing tools? I was using one too! I preferred Spendee but migrated from it for two reasons → I wanted something for my home serv...

entry.title: Hosting a Website using GitHub Pages and Jekyll

link.title: Hosting a Website using GitHub Pages and Jekyll

entry.summary: Covering Bases GitHub Pages is a straightforward method to deploy a website right from a GitHub repository, especially for those with computer science skills. In a very simplistic way, GitHub pages can simply use the repository root as the webroot and serve a website from there. It can also serve from a specific branch. The deployment of pages can be executed via GitHub Actions (GHA) or direc...
